children.value: We want contributing to Gatsby to be fun, enjoyable, and educational for anyone and everyone. Contributions go far beyond pull requests and commits; we are thrilled to receive a variety of other contributions including the following:
Blogging, speaking about, or creating tutorials about one of Gatsby‚Äôs many features. Mention
com so we can give pointers and tips (if you want them üòÑ) and help you spread the word. Please add your blog posts and videos of talks to our
Submitting new feature ideas through an RFC
Submitting new documentation; titles in the side navigation on
which are lighter in color on gatsbyjs.org are stubs and need contributions
(make sure to use the hashtag and/or @ mention us!)
Submitting documentation updates, enhancements, designs, or bugfixes
‚Äî especially determining whether an issue still persists or is reproducible
and helping someone else who needs help
Teaching others how to contribute to Gatsby‚Äôs repo!
As our way of saying ‚Äúthank you‚Äù to our contributors,
‚Äî whether you‚Äôre contributing code, docs, a talk, an article, or something else that helps the Gatsby community.
Learn how to claim free swag for contributors.

properties.aria-label: not sure how to start contributing permalink

children.value: Not sure how to start contributing?
If you are worried or don‚Äôt know where to start, you can always reach out to
or submit an issue and a maintainer can help give you guidance!
Looking to speak about Gatsby? We‚Äôd love to review your talk abstract/CFP! You can email it to shannon
com, and we can give pointers or tips!

properties.aria-label: creating your own plugins and loaders permalink

children.value: Creating your own plugins and loaders
If you create a loader or plugin, we would <3 for you to open source it and put it on npm. For more information on creating custom plugins, please see the documentation for
Gatsby uses a ‚Äúmonorepo‚Äù pattern to manage its many dependencies and relies on
to configure the repository for active development.
Yarn is a package manager for your code, similar to
. While NPM is used to develop Gatsby sites with the CLI, contributing to the Gatsby repo requires Yarn for the following reason: we use Yarn‚Äôs
feature that comes really handy for monorepos. It allows us to install dependencies from multiple
files in sub-folders, enabling a faster and lighter installation process.

{
  "workspaces": ["workspace-a", "workspace-b"]
}
Ensure you have the latest version of Yarn installed (>= 1.0.2).
Set up repo and install dependencies:
Make sure tests are passing for you:

, as this will short circuit the CI process and only run linting tasks

. To watch just one package, run
in each of the sites you‚Äôre testing.
For each of your Gatsby test sites, run the

command inside the test site‚Äôs directory to copy
the built files from your cloned copy of Gatsby. It‚Äôll watch for your changes
to Gatsby packages and copy them into the site. For more detailed instructions

Create a pull request from your branch.
Gatsby, unsurprisingly, uses Gatsby for its documentation website. Thank you in advance and cheers for contributing to Gatsby documentation! It‚Äôs people like you that make this community great!
Check the GitHub repo for issues labeled with
for your first time contributing to Gatsby, or
to see all documentation issues that are ready for community help. Once you start a PR to address one of these issues, you can remove the ‚Äúhelp wanted‚Äù label.

properties.aria-label: modifying markdown files in gatsby documentation permalink

children.value: Modifying markdown files in Gatsby documentation
If you want to add/modify any Gatsby documentation, go to the

and
use the file editor to edit and then preview your changes.
Before committing the change and raising a PR in the UI, you need to make sure the PR meets the docs contribution criteria: make sure your contribution meets the standards outlined in the
. Also, if your PR did not come from an issue written by the core team, please add a comment to your PR that explains why it should be included in the docs, according to the

Note: If your issue and/or PR doesn‚Äôt meet the above contribution criteria, it may receive a comment reminding you to do so. If, after two weeks, these updates haven‚Äôt been made, your issue and/or PR may be closed, which helps us triage issues and PRs efficiently. You can request that it be reopened if and when you are ready to make the updates required.
GitHub then allows you to commit the change and raise a PR right in the UI. This is the
way you can contribute to the project!
If you wrote a new document that was previously a stub, there are two things you need to update.
Remove the frontmatter that links to the issue

...
    title: Example Document
- - issue: https://github.com/gatsbyjs/gatsby/issues/00000
+ -
  ...
by removing the asterisk behind the document‚Äôs title:

...
- - title: Example Document*
+ - title: Example Document
    link: /docs/example-document/
  ...
